title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When a file is opened in one editor, attempting to open the same file in another editor does not trigger any action or display any message.
EB: The system should display a warning message when trying to open a file in another editor that is already open in one editor. The message should inform the user that they may overwrite changes and ask if they want to continue.
SR:
1. Close the file that is already opened in an editor. 
2. Go to the Java Perspective. 
3. Double click on a java file to open it. 
4. Right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' > 'System Editor'.
5. Observe that no warning or error message is displayed, indicating that the file is already open in another editor.
